author: wsjcom
title: Is the Fed Confused About Inflation’s Cause?
text:
Larry Kudlow and Stephen Moore set out to debunk the pervasive half-truth that inflation always is a result of rapid growth and low unemployment. They emphasize often overlooked supply-side increases that constrain inflationary forces (“Who’s Afraid of Higher Wages?,” op-ed, March 13).
They steer clear of the Federal Reserve’s central role in sowing confusion about the causes of inflation. The Fed’s obsession with its arbitrary 2% inflation target compels them to argue that higher inflation is desirable because it is always...
